alert.note: Alert for Tulare (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 31 at 11:37PM PST until further notice by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following counties, Fresno, Madera and Tulare. * WHEN...Until 130 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1137 PM PST, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 5 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Three Rivers, Yosemite Lakes, Balch Power House, Fence Meadow, Wishon Dam, Trimmer Springs, Dinkey Creek, Lake Wishon, Squaw Valley, Azalea Campground, Crystal Springs Campground, Grant Grove Visitor Center, Grant Grove, Sunset Campground, Pinehurst, West Woodchuck Meadow, Hume Lake, Shaver Lake 3ne, Park Ridge and Tamarack Summit. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
